thread.title: Rentrak Announces Official Worldwide Box Office Results for Weekend of July 26, 2015
thread.title_full: Rentrak Announces Official Worldwide Box Office Results for Weekend of July 26, 2015

title: Rentrak Announces Official Worldwide Box Office Results for Weekend of July 26, 2015
text:
Rentrak Announces Official Worldwide Box Office Results for Weekend of July 26, 2015 -- Only Rentrak Provides the Official Global Movie Results -- Rentrak 8 hours ago Content preferences Done 
LOS ANGELES, July 26, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Rentrak ( RENT ), the leader in precisely measuring movies and TV everywhere, today announced the official worldwide weekend box office estimates for the weekend of July 26, 2015, as compiled by the company's theatrical measurement services. 
As the trusted official standard for real-time worldwide box office reporting, Rentrak provides the only theater-level reporting in the world. Customers are able to analyze admissions and gross results around the world using Rentrak's suite of products. 
Rentrak's Senior Media Analyst Paul Dergarabedian commented, "Universal's 'Minions' continue to rake in the cash as the little guys dominated the worldwide box office adding another $66 million this weekend and bringing its total to a very non-Minion sized $759.4 million. Disney/Marvel's 'Ant-Man' also had a great weekend at the global box office with $60.2 million in 48 international territories and North America. Notably in the third spot, the 3-D fantasy/adventure "Monster Hunt" from China earned a whopping $46 million in just five territories and has now $211 million in the bank." 
The top 12 worldwide weekend box office estimates, listed in descending order, per data collected as of Sunday, July 26, 2015, are below. 
1. Minions - Universal - $66.1M 3. Monster Hunt - Multiple - $46.0M 4. Pixels - Sony - $45.4M 5. Inside Out - Disney - $35.7M 6. Jian Bing Man (Pancake Man) - Multiple - $25.0M 7. Paper Towns - 20th Century Fox - $20.5M 8. Southpaw - Multiple - $20.0M 9. Assassination, The - Showbox - $19.5M 10. Trainwreck - Universal - $17.5M 11. Monkey King: Hero is Back - Multiple - $17.0M 12. Jurassic World - Universal - $14.5M 
The top 12 domestic weekend box office estimates, listed in descending order, per data collected as of Sunday, July 26, 2015, are below. 
1. Ant-Man - Disney - $24.8M
